docs.lead_paragraph: Affairs at Washington lack pungency. The usual quantum of confirmations took place yesterday, and among them the following: Wm. F. Colcock, Collector at Charleston; Evans as District Attorney at Boston, and Col. Jack Hays as Survey-or-General of California. Nominations were sent in for the new officers of the recently established Territory of Washington, as follows: Major Stevens of the Topographical Engineers as Governor, and Capt. Clendennon of Louisiana as District Attorney.

headline.main: LEAVES FROM THE JOURNAL OF A NEW-YORK CLERGYMAN,; During the first half of the present Century. NUMBER TWO.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Hudson River and Robert Fulton. In the-Spring of 1810, my health was found to have suffered from close application to study and other duties of my profession. Relaxation, change of air and change of scene became indispensable; and my fondness for the Hudson River and the fine regions of country which line both its banks soon determined me where to go.

docs.lead_paragraph: Exile of the Archbishop of Santa Fe De Begotn--A Meeting of the Catholic Clergy. A meeting of the clergy, and laity of New York, for the purpose of expressing their admiration and sympathy towards the Archbishop of Santa Fe de Bogota, lately banished from New-Grenada, and now a resident of this City, was held Monday morning, at the Church of the Transfiguration, Chambers-street.

headline.main: CELEBRATION OF ST. PATRICK'S DAY.; Grand Procession of Military, &c. ORATION BY LIEUT. COL. DOHENY. BANQUETS, SPEECHES, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The anniversary of St. Patrick was celebrated yesterday, with a spirit and display superior to any previous observance of the occasion. The day, though somewhat gloomy and threatening, held up until after the procession. About 10 o'clock, the military organizations, under command of Col. B. C. FERRIS, formed in East Broadway, where they awaited the arrival of the several Civic Societies, marshaled under Mr. THOS, MCKIERNAN.
docs.abstract: Speech at the dinner of the Friendly Sons of St Patrick

docs.lead_paragraph: Carmelich, the Spaniard, who lately in Jack son County, Miss., walked away from the Sheriff, a few months before his neck was to have ornamented a noose, and whose modesty prevented his consenting to a public exhibition of himself, has sailed for Spain. So it will probably happen that the hanging will have to be indefinitely postponed.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have dates from the City of Mexico to the 22d ult., conveying little news in addition to what has already been received. Mexican Plenipotentiaries have been appointed to treat with the American Minister for the settlement of the terms of neutrality on the Tehuantepec treaty.

docs.lead_paragraph: Prayer by Rev. Mr. REED. PETITIONS PRESENTED AND REFERRED. Mr. CONGER, for the repeal of the law relative to taking oysters in the Harlem River; Mr. WRIGHT, two, on the exercise question; Mr. BEEKMAN, of JOHN F. RODMAN and others for a ferry-boat from New-York to Fort Hamilton.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Prometheus, Capt. CHURCHILL, arrived here yesterday morning from San Juan on the 6th inst. She brings the passengers of the Brother Jonathan, from San Francisco.
docs.snippet: The steamship Prometheus, Capt. CHURCHILL, arrived here yesterday morning from San Juan on the 6th inst. She brings the passengers of the Brother Jonathan, from San Francisco.

docs.lead_paragraph: ATTEMPT TO KILL.--Officer JAMES McKINNEY, of the Second District Police, arrested a man yesterday named GEORGE DERRICKSON, charged with entering the sugar refinery of Mr. BENSON, in Water-street, the day before, and attempting to kill GEORGE C. OLIVER.
